name: age
description: Age of the patients in years

name: death
description: Death at any time up to National Death Index (NDI) data on 31 of December of 1994. Some patients are discharged before the end of the study and are not followed up. The authors looked up the information about death.

name: sex
description: Gender of the patient. Listed values are {male, female}.

name: hospdead
description: Death in hospital

name: slos
description: Days from Study Entry to Discharge

name: d.time
description: Days of follow-up

name: dzgroup
description: The patient's disease sub category amogst ARF/MOSF w/Sepsis, CHF, COPD, Cirrhosis, Colon Cancer, Coma, Lung Cancer, MOSF w/Malig.

name: dzclass
description: The patient's disease category amongst "ARF/MOSF", "COPD/CHF/Cirrhosis", "Cancer", "Coma".

name: num.co
description: The number of simultaneous diseases (or comorbidities) exhibited by the patient. Values are ordinal with higher values indicating worse condition and chances of survival.

name: edu
description: Years of education

name: income
description: Income of the patient. Listed values are {"$11-$25k", "$25-$50k", ">$50k", "under $11k"}.

name: scoma
description: SUPPORT day 3 Coma Score based on Glasgow scale (predicted by a model).

name: charges
description: Hospital charges

name: totcst
description: Total ratio of costs to charges (RCC) cost

name: totmcst
description: Total micro cost

name: avtisst
description: Average TISS score, days 3-25, where Therapeutic Intervention Scoring System (TISS) is a method for calculating costs in the intensive care unit (ICU) and intermediate care unit (IMCU).

name: race
description: Race of the patient. Listed values are {asian, black, hispanic, missing, other, white}.

name: sps
description: SUPPORT physiology score on day 3 (predicted by a model).

name: aps
description: APACHE III day 3 physiology score (no coma, imp bun,uout for ph1)

name: surv2m
description: SUPPORT model 2-month survival estimate at day 3  (predicted by a model)

name: surv6m
description: SUPPORT model 6-month survival estimate at day 3  (predicted by a model)

name: hday
description: Day in hospital at which patient entered study.

name: diabetes
description: Whether the patient exhibits diabetes (Com 27-28, Dx 73) as a comorbidity (Y) or not (N).

name: dementia
description: Whether the patient exhibits dementia (Comorbidity 6) as a comorbidity (Y) or not (N).

name: ca
description: Whether the patient has cancer (yes), whether it has spread out (metastatic), or if it is healthy (no).

name: prg2m
description: Physician’s 2-month survival estimate for patient.

name: prg6m
description: Physician’s 6-month survival estimate for patient.

name: dnr
description: Whether the patient has a do not rescuscitate (DNR) order or not. Possible values are dnr after sadm, dnr before sadm, missing, no dnr.

name: dnrday
description: Day of DNR order (<0 if before study)

name: meanbp
description: mean arterial blood pressure of the patient, measured at day 3.

name: wblc
description: counts of white blood cells (in thousands) measured at day 3.

name: hrt
description: heart rate of the patient measured at day 3.

name: resp
description: respiration rate of the patient measured at day 3.

name: temp
description: temperature in Celsius degrees measured at day 3.

name: pafi
description: $PaO_2/FiO_2$ ratio measured at day 3. The ratio of arterial oxygen partial pressure (PaO2 in mmHg) to fractional inspired oxygen (FiO2 expressed as a fraction). Widely used clinical indicator of hypoxaemia, though its diagnostic utility is controversial. Specific ranges of values can be associated with different levels of mortality. May be worth considering binning these values according to some ranges: https://litfl.com/pao2-fio2-ratio/

name: alb
description: serum albumin levels measured at day 3.

name: bili
description: bilirubin levels measured at day 3.

name: crea
description: serum creatinine levels measured at day 3.

name: sod
description: serum sodium concentration measured at day 3.

name: ph
description: Arterial blood pH. The pH of blood is usually between 7.35 and 7.45. Abnormal results may be due to lung, kidney, metabolic diseases, or medicines. Head or neck injuries or other injuries that affect breathing can also lead to abnormal results.

name: glucose
description: Glucose levels measured at day 3.

name: bun
description: Blood urea nitrogen levels measured at day 3.

name: urine
description: Urine output measured at day 3.

name: adlp
description: Index of Activities of Daily Living (ADL) of the patient, filled out by the patient. Higher values indicate more chance of survival, measured at day 3.

name: adls
description: Index of Activities of Daily Living (ADL) of the patient, filled out by a surrogate (e.g. family member), measured at day 3. Higher values indicate more chance of survival.

name: sfdm2
description: Level of functional disability of the patient in a 1-5 scale, with 5 being the highest severity. The values were obtained via questionairres to the patient and/or surrogates to determine the Sickness Profile Impact (SIP). Values are correlated with ADLS, ADLP columns. Listed values are: {1: "no(Month 2 and SIP pres)", "adl>=4 (>=5 if sur)", "SIP>=30", "Coma or Intub", 5: "<2 mo. follow-up"}. There are 159 patients surviving 2 months for whom there were no patient or surrogate interviews. These patients have missing sfdm2.

name: adlsc
description: Imputed ADL Calibrated to Surrogate.
